Example.BHC Span: Home Xarelto/ASA held for ___ post-procedure with stable Hgb, followed by resumption of ASA and therapeutic anticoagulation with hep gtt for >24h
Example.AVS Span: You were on Xarelto and ASA for blood thinning, but these were held for a few days after the procedure, and then you were resumed on ASA and therapeutic anticoagulation with heparin.

Example.BHC Span: Home Xarelto was resumed on the evening of discharge.
Example.AVS Span: You were on Xarelto and ASA for blood thinning, but these were held for a few days after the procedure, and then you were resumed on ASA and therapeutic anticoagulation with heparin.

Example.BHC Span: Patient will also ___ with ERCP team for repeat EGD in 6 months.
Example.AVS Span: You will need to schedule follow-up appointments with your PCP and GI/ERCP team for a follow-up EGD in 6 months.

Example.BHC Span: Home amiodarone and metoprolol continued on d/c.
Example.AVS Span: You were also on amiodarone and metoprolol for your atrial fibrillation, which is now in normal rhythm.

Example.BHC Span: Transaminitis: ALT mildly elevated in 40-50 range; etiology unclear, amiodarone use. Stable, and further w/u deferred to PCP.
Example.AVS Span: You had a history of coronary artery disease, heart failure with preserved ejection fraction, high blood pressure, and a gastric neuroendocrine tumor.
Your blood count (Hgb) dropped to 6.8, but it has since stabilized and is now at 7.9.
